benchmark_details.name: Bias in the Picture: Benchmarking VLMs with Social-Cue News Images and LLM-as-Judge Assessment
benchmark_details.overview: We introduce a benchmark constructed from real-world news images paired with open-ended questions, annotated for age, gender, race, occupation, and sport, enabling joint evaluation of both bias and faithfulness in multimodal reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically audit how visible social cues modulate stereotypes in multimodal LLMs.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Our dataset is constrained in scale and domain, focusing on news images from a one-year period.

data.source: Images collected from Google News RSS feeds across various topics.
data.annotation: Annotated with demographic and social attributes by trained annotators.

methodology.calculation: The rubric scores the models based on Bias (lower is better), Answer Relevance (higher is better), Faithfulness to the image (higher is better).
methodology.baseline_results: Various vision-language models were evaluated with scores on accuracy, bias and faithfulness.
methodology.validation: Results were validated through human verification.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Removed personally identifiable elements and obtained informed consent from annotators.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Compliant with institutional privacy policies and relevant data regulations.
